comments.author: tombei@gmail.com
comments.creator: tombei@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Certificates on Gemalto smart card are ignored while doing SSL client certificate authentication if more than 1 certificate is present on the smart card. Certificates have the same Subject, but different serials and intended purposes. If if only 1 certificate  left on the smart card, SSL client certificate authentication works fine. 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install new security module (Gemalto's gclib.dll)
2. insert the card
3. Connect to https:// site supporting SSL client certificate authentication
4. Enter master password for device
Actual Results:  
SSL client certificate authentication is not attempted

Expected Results:  
Request user to choose between certificates

All certificates listed correctly under My Certificates.
